definition: to reckon/to consider/to turn over in one's mind
to think/to consider
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to measure

sentences.english: Felton has to be looking over his shoulder after the Bobcats made a strong play for T.
sentences.chinese: 費爾頓得好好思量一下，畢竟夏天山貓向T。

sentences.english: Concerned that the boy might get hurt, the referee called a time-out.
sentences.chinese: 思量到他大概受傷，裁判叫了停息。

sentences.english: Let me consider the matter well before deciding.
sentences.chinese: 讓我細細思量後再決定吧。

sentences.english: It was a nice tactical problem, whether she should ever ask him.
sentences.chinese: 她該不該問他呢，這倒是個很費思量的問題。

sentences.english: It will take something very special to avoid relegation.
sentences.chinese: 由此可見，要想避免降級，萊切得好好費些思量。

sentences.english: And I thought about it. I thought about it a lot.
sentences.chinese: 我考慮了很久，仔細思量了。

sentences.english: Qianlong calm thinking after forgive the little swallow and recognize the crape myrtle.
sentences.chinese: 乾隆冷靜思量之後原諒了小燕子並認了紫薇。
他的行爲明顯是欠思量。

sentences.english: The government tried to hammer out an agreement with workers.
sentences.chinese: 政府費煞思量設法和工人達成一項協議。

sentences.english: We may mull things over and over in our minds to see if we've missed a clue.
sentences.chinese: 我們往往費煞思量，不容錯過任何線索。

sentences.english: On second thought, you can still look for the person of your dreams without leaving your house.
sentences.chinese: 再三思量，你足不出戶也可以找到自己的夢中情人。

sentences.english: Should you thellonk favorably of my application, I would like to have an interview.
sentences.chinese: 如對於本人之應徵優先思量，懇請惠予面試之時機。

sentences.english: They both thought for a minute.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩人思量了一會兒。

sentences.english: Perhaps we want to ponder the road not taken.
sentences.chinese: 或許我們是想思量自己沒有選擇的那條路。

sentences.english: Certainly, the wealthy brocade once deliberated for well to a little bit send goodwill gestures what in the applicable opportune moment.
sentences.chinese: 當然，錦繡也思量過在適當的時機稍微的示好什麼的。

sentences.english: Now experts are pondering the many questions raised by the news.
sentences.chinese: 現在專家們正思量着這條消息所引發的種種疑問。

definition: to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
to think sth through/to consider carefully
to hesitate
to think deeply/to ponder
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
to plot/to scheme/to calculate
to consider/to ponder
to speculate/to surmise/to wonder whether/to guess
to mutter to oneself irresolutely
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to think hard/bitter thoughts/to pour out one's sufferings
silent/speechless
to turn over in one's mind (idiom); to think through from different angles/to ponder
to turn things over in one's mind/to conjecture/to guess
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to contemplate/to ponder/contemplation/meditation
